clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Different Preoperative Decision Schemes on the Visual Quality After Toric Intraocular Lens Implantation
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Different Preoperative Decision Schemes on the Visual Quality After Toric Intraocular Lens Implantation

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: To study the Influence of Different Preoperative Decision Schemes on the Visual Quality After Toric Intraocular Lens Implantation

Corneal aberrations are measured with OPD-Scan Ⅲ

intervention.intervention_name: phacoemulsification and Toric intraocular lens implantation
intervention.description: A clear corneal incision is made in a different position

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age-related cataract (age 55-80)
2. Corneal astigmatism is greater than 1.0D
3. Patients who are willing to implant Toric IOL
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Previous or present eye diseases, such as glaucoma, eye trauma, etc
2. High refractive error
3. Previous eye surgery
4. Irregular astigmatism of the cornea

facility.name: Second Affiliated Hospital, Zhejiang University School of Medicine
